instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook A1989, 820-00850, won't boot
threads.message:
Please, use ONLY schematic points to specify readings.
You made very difficult to read this post.
A lot of readings, which don't help too much.

My first question, all USB-C ports have the same behavior?
AUX_DET should have 1.25V aprox; did you inject 5V there?
Not sure what mean the readings bellow "20V switch over..."; did you inject 20V on the board?

BTW, do not use "V" when you post diode mode readings.

threads.title: Macbook A1989, 820-00850, won't boot
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 103882, member: 682"]
Please, use ONLY schematic points to specify readings.
You made very difficult to read this post.
A lot of readings, which don't help too much.

My first question, all USB-C ports have the same behavior?
AUX_DET should have 1.25V aprox; did you inject 5V there?
Not sure what mean the readings bellow "20V switch over..."; did you inject 20V on the board?

BTW, do not use "V" when you post diode mode readings.
[/QUOTE]
I apologize if I’m doing something wrong or asking stupid questions, I’m not experienced and I’m a newbie.
I will try to take into account your wishes.
If you put the board in the MacBook and connect it to the battery, it switches to 20V 0.00A and nothing happens, it doesn’t boot. If you then take it out on the table, the indicators and behavior on all four ports are identical.
CHGR_AUX_DET=1.25v

threads.title: Macbook A1989, 820-00850, won't boot
threads.message: if you leave the board connected to charging for a while, the readings will fluctuate 5.080-5.087v and 0.276 -0.298a

threads.title: Macbook A1989, 820-00850, won't boot
threads.message:
Any fault history available?
Is the machine detected into DFU mode?

threads.title: Macbook A1989, 820-00850, won't boot
threads.message: According to the owner, it simply stopped turning on. not displayed in DFU!

threads.title: Macbook A1989, 820-00850, won't boot
threads.message:
Check SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages around U7800.
Be aware, puting the Mac in DFU is not simple as you think.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/DFU_Mode_Restore_(Macs)[/URL]
You may need to force it, with wires method.

Any reason to quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above?
Please, maintain the forum aesthetic...
